title: The Block 2019 episode 41 recap: Shaynna Blaze weeps over Deb and Andy’s room
text:
The gamble (and the gnome) paid off for Tess and Luke.

Faced with the very real prospect they’d have to down tools after this week, the Cairns couple threw what little money they had left at their studio apartment to create a self-contained unit.

Judges Shaynna Blaze, Neale Whitaker and Darren Palmer were impressed by the practicality of their efforts, remarking that the space could be used as a teenage haven, a flat for elderly relatives, or a space to house an au pair.

RELATED:

How to create a winning Block bedroom

Episode 39/40 recap: Tess and Luke finally run out of cash

But they were equally impressed by Mitch and Mark’s Sex and the City-style wardrobe and bathroom design, Jesse and Mel’s luxurious suite, Deb and Andy’s “emotional” budget boudoir and yet another master bedroom with OTT wallpaper from El’ise and Matt.

With the race close between all five teams, Tess and Luke played their gnome to add a bonus point to their own score, allowing them to triumph over frontrunners Jesse and Mel and Mitch and Mark, who otherwise would have tied for first place.

Not only did the $10,000 prize present Tess and Luke with a stay of execution, it had the added bonus of allowing them to triumph over Mitch and Mark who have been sparring in a cold war with the other couples ever since they were prevented from putting in a spa bath.

The win must also make foreman Keith eat his words after predicting that they would come last yet again this week.

Keith and his offsider Dan have taken great delight in watching Tess and Luke putting in the hard yards to stay in the game. They’ve always accused the pair of being lazy and outsourcing too much work to paid trades rather than doing the grunt work themselves.

Dan and Keith have also tipped a bucket (quite literally) over Jesse’s efforts for the opposite reason. They felt the real estate agent had become sloppy because he was trying to do too much.

Never shy at coming forward, Jesse quickly pointed out the hypocrisy in Keith’s scathing assessments of his tiling work. And he has a point. If Keith was to be believed, contestants were foolish to try to do all their own labour and equally foolish if they paid skilled labourers. He can’t have it both ways.

There’s no doubting that with everyone’s money close to running out, all five teams have pulled out all the stops this week to present rooms on the cheap. And that’s likely to be the story from here on in, unless one of the many sponsors decides to cough up some more cash.

For Mitch and Mark that frugality has meant pinching flowers from the neighbours’ gardens to add a touch of greenery to the dressing room Darren extravagantly dubbed a “strut-in ‘robe” rather than a mere “walk-in ‘robe”.

Even notorious big-spender El’ise has had to rein it in. She resorted to using bargain-basement Margaret Thatcher autobiographies as decorative items in her room. Neale was not impressed. In fact, he felt quite certain, as an Englishman, that El’ise would be the only person on the planet, apart from the late Iron Lady herself, to have the books in pride of place in the bedroom wardrobe.

Andy and Deb took the cost-cutting much further and completely axed their en suite to use the studio solely as a large bedroom. The neutral-hued room reduced Shaynna to tears. In a good way. She felt a connection to the room because it had been “made with love”. Righto!

Little did she know that this supposedly tranquil retreat was, just hours before, the site of Deb and Andy’s first big dust-up in 10 weeks on The Block.

“You’re annoying me so much,” the usually laid-back Deb told Andy when he said he didn’t really care that he had painted the walls the wrong colour.

“That’s always the attitude when it comes to the styling and the painting. ‘Everything is crap. Everything is f***ed. Everything is ‘I don’t care!’ So, I have to do it all. I have to care and do it all.”

Unfortunately for Deb and the other contestants, they are going to have to get used to doing it all themselves if they are to finish the biggest renovation in Block history with the meagre budgets they were given.
